summary: Email correspondence regarding custody restrictions for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack DOC, including requests to add her New York attorneys to her permitted contact list and detailing strict monitoring protocols due to her high-profile status.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email, detailing her custody restrictions at Merrimack DOC as a high-profile inmate.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Attorney already on the permitted contact list for Ghislaine Maxwell to communicate with.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: One of Maxwell's New York attorneys requested to be added to her permitted phone contact list.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: One of Maxwell's New York attorneys requested to be added to her permitted phone contact list.

connections.description: Vogelman is listed as legal counsel authorized to communicate with Maxwell while in custody.
Everdell is one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the sender requests be added to her permitted contact list.
Cohen is one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the sender requests be added to her permitted contact list.
Both are New York attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Custody Restrictions Issued
events.description: The U.S. Marshals Service issues detailed custody restrictions for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack DOC, including housing in medical, 15-minute observation watches, and limited attorney contact.

events.title: Request to Add Attorneys to Contact List
events.description: An email is sent requesting that Maxwell's New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, be added to her permitted phone contact list to facilitate case discussions.

events.title: Documentation Delivery Deadline
events.description: Supervisors are directed to deliver downloaded touch probe rounds and camera footage from Maxwell's cell to a specified location.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at Merrimack DOC under strict monitoring protocols due to her high-profile status.
She was initially only authorized to communicate with her legal counsel, Lawrence Vogelman, after he provided a PIN.
A request was made to add her New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, to her permitted phone contact list to facilitate case discussions.
Maxwell was housed in a medical cell, under 15-minute observation watches, with all rounds documented and video footage downloaded daily.
Staff were prohibited from conversing with Maxwell outside of health and safety requirements and from making statements to the press.
